review: Super excited that Red Robin is FINALLY in an Orlando area close to me! Attended an opening 'preview' & OMG!!! Yummmm is an understatement! For starters we had the Poutine which was amazingly yummy followed by The Red Robin gourmet burger which was not only huge but delicious too! Chose the sweet potato fries, way better than I'd expected! All in all the place was very welcoming & clean, the staff was super friendly & helpful and the food was absolutely delicious! Can't wait to go back!!!

Nice of them to turn everyone away from their doors when there are multiple maps, websites etc with their "open" hours. Waste of a 30 min drive to meet a friend. None of the people that were told they weren't welcome because they didn't have a "reservation" will ever come back especially since they were turned away without any incentive or even a coupon offered. Really poor management and poor marketing by this location. Don't expect to ever get service here if this is how their launch is running.
Food and staff was great!  Great options for kids too ....So excited to have a Red Tobin nearby!

Outstanding!  And this was at the soft opening!  Attentive from the moment I stepped through the door!  Smiles, laughs , happy employees!  The food was super good, no wait as it came out hot, fresh and timely! Special kudus to Whitney, Kelly, Diane, and the whole hotels stand!  See you soon! Thanks for a great meal !

Well tried new location near the airport... took 17 yr old grandson... an appetizer, 2 sodas, 2 burgers...$40?!!!! really?...$2.70 for a glass of soda?... the gimmick of all the fries u want just doesn't excite me... their reward app didn't work after we both downloaded and installed it on our phones, the one handicapped stall in the ladies room was out of order (2nd day of operation?!), paid using the thing on table but it didn't print my receipt (had to call our server over again and she had to go somewhere to get a printout for me), AND was charged for a tiny 1/2-full condiment cup of extra sauce for my $14 burger! I specified NO MUSHROOMS on my bleu cheese burger... it came loaded with them!  Paid extra for the garlic cheese fries... very greasy... Loudmouth's parmesan-garlic fries are MUCH better and they don't charge you extra when you choose a flavored variety of fries!Won't be back... over priced... burger had great flavor (except for mushrooms) but not at that price! Soooooooo disappointed... they are really overpriced on everything except the appetizers!
Unorganized and very expensive for the quality of the food. We paid 15 dollars for a burger that was very ehhh.

Kayleigh our server was a very nice girl. Very attentive. That being said unfortunately for her she works at a place that sells $15 dollar burgers that can't even be cooked medium because of the quality of the beef!!! I will never see Kayleigh again...

Not going to be a repeat customer. Food was very salty, hamburger was very thin/small (Mckids meal thin/small). Worst part was the milk shake. I had to send it back. It did not look like anything in the picture, the chocolate could have been vanilla it was so bland.  Server and overall service was good.

In the words of Guybrush Threepwood: "IT'S PINK!" So we come here during our lunch break, and the place is slammed, no surprise there. We expected a longer wait. About 30 minutes after ordering our food arrives. I ordered my usual: a Banzai Burger, no pink, with garlic fries (y'all know I'm the Fry Snob). Everyone else's food was perfect, but my burger was so pink, there's no way it should have taken a half hour to arrive. I asked for a new burger, and they brought me a basket of fries while I wait. Our server was super nice about everything. A manager was going around checking on tables, so, I asked him to make mine to go since we had to get back to work. He brings my order, and I notice something's off:  This Banzai is on a ciabatta roll This Banzai has arugula and sun dried tomatoes on it This Banzai has garlic aioli This Banzai is not a Banzai. It's a D.G.B. This D.G.B. has a side of onion rings with it. I'M THE **bleeping** FRY SNOB!  We were already running so late, I just decided to accept the burger and leave. I guess some other customer got stuck with my well done Banzai. I get back to work and take a bite of the burger. Yep... you guessed it... PINK. Thankfully they comped my meal. Tears wet my keyboard as I write this review. Sadly this Red Robin just isn't ready for prime time. I've been a fan of Red Robin for 15 years and this was easily the worst visit ever. I know they're new, but dang...

So we gave this place another go. Big mistake.  Service was ok. But that's if your order is right. The appetizer comes out very quickly. However the burger comes out half an hour later. And the sad part is you would be better off at McDonalds. At least the burger would have flavor and the meal wouldn't cost you 50 bucks. Oh and there was no alcohol envolved for that price. So unless you can eat that much of the bottomless fries save your money and go for fast food. You may not have a wait person to serve you but you get better taste and more for your money.  You may not got a balloon but you could pick one up at the store on the way home with less aggravation. Listening to a helium tank through the entire meal, and a balloon popping now and than, is it a circus?

By far the best burger ever. My familys new favorite spot. Cliff is our new favorite server. Chopp house burger and southern charm burgers are Just unbelievably juicy . My boys got the double  out tavern double w bacon aoli and garlic parm fries, and a cheese pizza. Words cannot express how good the burgers are. Come see for yourself. Cliff you rocked it out!
This has to be the most over priced nastiest burger I have ever eaten. When we ordered more fries the prison guard waitress threw them at us. Never again bye felcia.

Love the Burgers and Fries.  Not happy with the wait.  Don't get it.  Bottomless fries should not mean bottomless wait.  What is up with that!  15 minute wait on refill.  45 minute wait on original order.  Folks.  It is burgers and fries.  Not to mention we were given someone else's check.   Will come back but improvements are needed.

My husband went in for some RR to go. first time trying it and we were not excited at all.  He got the buzz mac n cheese burger which looked NOTHING like what was pictured. It had no flavor. In his words "worse then a checkers burger" I had the whiskey river burger - med rare but it was way too pink to actually enjoy.  First bite was better then my husbands mac and cheese burger. Fries were greasier then most fast food chains... don't think I'll be going to this place again. Especially not for overpriced sloppy burgers.

We have experienced this chain at the Sanford location, first time here near OIA, do not recommend.  I am in a wheel chair and asked to remain in chair, we were placed at a very busy aisle from the kitchen to the dinning area and had 9 different servers and 4 different guests trip onto my chair or bump into me while we ate.  At the time we were placed at this table I asked the server if I would be in the way and she just shrugged her shoulders.  The server told my husband if he didn't like the coleslaw he could reorder fries, well when he didn't care for the coarse texture and reordered fries he was told it would be a 12 min wait, 30 min later still no fries, she finally returned 5 min later and said she took someone else's fries from the window. Biggest insult of all was when we got home and turned on tv saw another ad for the Bottomless fries!!!

So glad we have a legit burger joint by the airport. Considering it's a somewhat touristy area with all the surrounding hotels, the wait time was minimal. Good beer and good food. The poutine needs more gravy but not bad at their attempt to getting it close to what you get north of the border.

My first and last visit to this resteraunt and here is why:      We were a party of 2 which is the easiest for any server. I know this because I have worked as a resteraunt server, cook, driver, cashier, runner and manager of many different  food service venues including fast food and full service.      We both ordered a sandwich. I chose the unlimited salad refills as my side and my wife ordered the garlic fries. Our food was brought to us by someone other than our server. My wife was given someone else's sandwich. When they brought a second sandwich, it still wasn't what she ordered and we still have not seen our server since we placed our order. I did get 1 salad refill from our server when she finally made an appearance to our table. I never got another because she never returned until we were done eating.       The fries were greasy and soggy. The sandwiches were small and no different than what can be purchased at other and least expensive venues. My drink was never refilled and our table was never pre-bussed. Our bill for this experience was just under $30.00. The food was in no way worth the price!! It's a good thing for the server that my wife left a $3.00 tip because I would have tipped the spare change in my pocket.        The sad part is this is a brand new store and my experience has been that the opening crew are the best because they receive the best training. What a waste of a new building.       I am being generous giving this one 2 stars.

Went for a second time......not even worth a star at all. This place is just damn awful. Service is terrible and started with the drinks. We both had water w/ lemon. Pretty easy and simple to order right? It comes out with no ice and no lemon. You got to be kidding me!? What is this a jail!? We ordered two new buzz Mac n cheese burgers. Asked for no lettuce. They both come 30 minutes later with lettuce on it. The picture showed that the burger had loaded yellow Mac and cheese on it. Now our burgers had 3 pieces of macaroni and white cheese sauce which you had to look for to see it. Whatever other aioli sauce was on there, wasn't even present. The fries bottomless!? What fries!?? They gave us Literally 10 fries that were horrible and we asked for one of the no charge dipping sauces. She brings out ketchup. We asked for the Red Robin tavern sauce which is pretty much 1000 island dressing. We never saw the server again. So nice we could pay at the table and leave no tip without feeling the guilt. She deserved her tip of nothing. The moment we walked in and got the eye roll about asking for a seat in the dining area was a clue that we should have walked the heck out. They honestly expect you to sit at the bar or at the high top tables that have no room at all!? Honestly this place could close and be tore down and made a parking lot, I wouldn't even care. It's that horrible and I hope everyone takes this review seriously because I'm not kidding about this place. It's gone down hill since they opened and now I'd say rock bottom. I'll never, ever give this place a try again. I'm done with Red Robin. I'll keep my business for a hamburger with checkers or McDonald's. For the owners that may read this: Please just close and leave the neighborhood, your business isn't wanted not only by me, but several others by the looks of it.   If you can't get a simple order right on a slow night, you shouldn't operate a restaurant at all. Especially an order of ice water with lemon! I will be calling corporate but I doubt they will even care either. Most of these places can give a crap less about your opinions. They just expect you to take your opinion and shove it. I'll be there for the closing party when the wrecking ball tears it down.
I ordered a very pink burger   well the picture explains why they are so slow it admire than well done. Of a burger restaurant can't prepare a burger ...    Just stay away!!!

My husband's a true Red Robin fan so we were thrilled when they opened up in our neighborhood. I had not been for about a decade. Well, after dining there for the first time last night, The Thrill is Gone. I ordered the burger that made them famous. It had lettuce tomato relish and onion. I requested no cheese. The bread was dry and crumbling apart yet the bottom bun soaked in relish. The burger was thin, dry and overcharred. It seemed pre-cooked and very processed. My fries were hard and solid all the way through. I took one bite and that was enough to know that this was not my type of burger. A Burger King Whopper would be of better quality.

Came on a Thursday night in a party of 7. We were seated pretty quickly. Our server was nice but all over the place. She kept telling us she would be right back after doing whatever. After doing this three times she finally came to take our drink and appetizer orders.  Got the onion ring tower and boneless chicken with sauce on the side. Came out at a reasonable time and it was good.  Our burgers took a little longer than we'd liked. When we finally got our food, it was warm and delicious. No wrong orders. Except my sweet potato fries which were limp, bland and cold. Very disappointed.  After getting our food, we didn't see our server for a while and when she finally came, we ordered more fries. At this point we had paid already and was waiting for the fries. She finally came with one batch and said another was coming. But it was taking way too long and so we left.  The burgers itself were good, maybe a little too much sauce but other than that, it was good, very filling.  I would give it another chance and hopefully it will be a much better experience.
The burgers were not well cooked.  Fries were sparse and the time to service was exhausting.  Mgmt really needs to think about re-working the front of the house.

Well... we gave this place a second chance. We will not be back. No napkins, no silver ware. If it's going to be greasy it should taste good! I'll just go to Five guys. It's that simple. Reeeeed Robin! Yucccck!

Always busy, due to location, but the wait is never too bad. Friendly service and good food. My favorite burger is the banzai with its slightly sweet flavor thanks to the pineapple and teriyaki sauce. If you're a fan of milkshakes and beer, try the Blue Moon shake; so delish. I've visited this location a few times over the last two months and have had no issues, both with dine in and to go.

Slow service! Food didn't look anything like in the menu, was never asked how we wanted our burgers cooked, server came back to offer us drink refills AFTER we had someone else do it for us because he took too long to come check on us, smelled strongly of cigarettes.

My husband and I were here for the first time since they opened! We love the Red Robin restaurant at home in Fayetteville NC! This was quite a disappointment! Sat at the bar per our usual because we get great service from the bartenders......usually. My husband and I ordered our drinks and his beer came out a good 10 minutes earlier than my mixed drink. We watched three other patrons sit down, get their orders taken and get their drinks while she told us 'we're making it now', clearly seeing that no one was making my drink. We ordered and got our food that was average to say the least! The Pub Mac-n-Cheese was sub par with the cheese not even melted! I can say it will be a very long time before we come back!

This was a good place to take a large family group with kids. More like 2 1/2 stars than three. As in fair to good. It's not a place we would go regularly.  The kids menu had lots of choices and the endless fries were a big hit. The pizza didn't look the best but that's what they wanted. It came with a choice of side -- everything from veggies to apple slices.  Meanwhile there is a full bar for adults. Happy hour prices on a number of items all the time. The margarita was good.  The regular menu features burgers, but there are salads, sides, soups, chicken, fish, etc. I didn't like my chicken Caesar  wrap especially and the onion soup (soup and sandwich combo) wasn't hot enough and was too salty. The cod fish and chips were very good, however, and one of the guys liked his burger (it came with a fried egg on top!). For dessert we ordered their tower of cronuts -- these came with two dipping sauces (chocolate and strawberry). These were excellent -- served warm almost like a beignet and the warm chocolate sauce was good as well.  The server was very patient with our large party but a bit overwhelmed as she had a number of large tables. The kitchen was slow -- took a while with dishes being prepared. We ordered the kids pizza first and it took way longer than it should have.

Grease everywhere on our food, the bottomless fries start with 5 fries and we asked with garlic herb which was a huge mistake! Our server was nice, I felt bad that we had to keep pointing out to her all the kitchen mistakes. Do not order the hamburgers, the salad or those pretzel bites which leaves you with nothing so go somewhere else!

Worth the money...my only complaint? Too much food! Lol...seriously my burger was way too big for me to eat the whole thing. I only made it halfway through the entire burnin' love burger, but boy was it flavorful!
Awful. Hostesses don't know what they are doing. Told us 10-15 minutes. We waited 50. Had they told us 10-15, we wouldn't have stayed. Ruined our experience.

Red Robin, Orlando, FL Stopped  by Red Robin (by the airport) on Saturday February 25, 2017 to see what the hype was about.   We were greeted and seated promptly.  The place wasn't so busy; however, there were dirty tables all over and really dirty floors.   Our waitress, Vanessa, was sweet and friendly.  She recommended a few items in the menu from drinks to burgers .  And those were great choices.   Within a few minutes after ordering our short stack onions rings, the staff started to pick up the dirty tables and vacuuming the floors.   Besides the onion rings, we order a beer, a strawberry lemonade and shared a black & blue burger.  Vanessa had too many tables and we had to remind her to refill my husbands drink several times.   I don't think we got the Black and Blue burger but it was ok.   Negative:  I didn't think this place was WOW!! It was expensive.  We paid $36 for one beer, one lemonade, a small order of onions rings and one burger.  I could have gotten the same with happy hour at Chilis for a lot less money !!!  Would I go back?  Not really.

Not impressed by Red Robbins at all. The burgers are good but nothing great. Honestly, I rather go to Five Guys or steak and shake cause I know I'll get a way better tasting burger and milk shake than what I got here. Not everything is bad about Red Robbins. They do offer endless sides with your burger and I ordered sweet potato fries but again, even the fries were nothing special. I tried their Oreo cookie milkshake and it was way too thick for me. For food, I ordered a BBQ burger and it just wasn't anything special. It's fresh and cooked the way I like it but I wasn't blown away. One of the things I do like about Red Robbins is their very "pro America" decor. Cool setup. Overall, I'm probably not coming back. There's better options nearby for a good burger.

Wonderful to have a Red Robin in East Orlando finally. Service is usually fabulous. Ask for Lauren, she's really on top of your order. Austin as well. Great burgers and more. The never ending fries are so good.  The shakes are very filling. Try the Guinness shake. It is surprisingly delicious, and I hate beer.

Clean and great idea on bottomless fries ! But ...... my sweet potato fries were skinny and burnt.  Got 3 baskets of fries and all were the same way So def not paying the up-charge for that  Food is decent. Nothing crazy.  Burgers aren't that big either. So don't get your hopes up  Service is ok as well   My server forgot our drinks a few times. And never picked up the table w all the cups and plates all over the area considering we were a group of 4.  Barely any space to even want to order desert.

Great job to Red Robin.  Food is great, prices are awesome, we love the royal Red Robin.  Plus, garlic fried are out of this world.  We just can't stop eating at Red Robin!!  Unlimited fries, where else can you do that!

Been to this Red Robin by the Orlando Int Airport a handful of times and the only thing that's consistent is that you really good service at the bar. The first two times I walked in I looked at the dining room and it looked like Romper Room! it was dirty, messy, unkept and the floor was filthy. Though the servers are polite.  Food is overpriced for what you get, quality not quantity.  The bottomless fries would be a great offer if they weren't the size of football players fingers!  Anyhow, come by the bar and I might run into you and we'll talk about absolutely nothing! Ah good times!!  Two stars service, one for food.

I love the consistent quality of the burgers here! The variety is excellent as well. Great onion rings and the accompanying sauce was magnificent! A little more expensive than the average burger but I believe it's worth a "splurge". Good stoping place before the airport if you have a little extra time before the flight.

Was. It impressed this time. Some how they also got cheese in a salad that did not call for it. Two words 1. Quality 2. Control. The inside looks neat and the all you can eat frys is really good. The all you can drink strawberry and lemonade drink is really good.

You can get a better, cheaper burger at Five Guys down the road. Maybe not as "fancy" but if memory serves me well, Steak and Shake has a Royale Burger and I'd rather drive a little further for that one. After seeing commercials for so many years and finally getting to try this place, I was extremely disappointed. The burger was ok, I guess but I don't dine out for okay food or service. I can do that for much cheaper at home. But then again, I can make a better burger. Bottomless steak fries were bland and tasteless.

Very disappointed.  The restaurant seemed very dirty.  Trash and spilled food all over floor.  Drink was wrong. Fries cold and soggy.  Burger barely average.  Manager should have been ordering her employees to clean or she should start hustling to it herself.

Stopped for lunch, ordered the Cod Fish and Chips and drinks. The server had some trouble with understanding which fish and chips (there was only one on the menu). She offered a suggestion of the "white" Sangria, but brought out the regular red as there isn't a white. Changed my drink order to a pale ale, they didn't have any as the manager explained when she came to see why there was an issue with the drink order. Waitress said there she knew for sure they had no malt vinegar as she used to work in the kitchen. The manager said they absolutely have it. Food was mediocre, fries didn't taste fresh. Very disappointing will not be returning.

This was my very first time at a Red Robin ever and the first impression I got from the moment that we walked in was that they don't have enough staff to tend to tables. Our waitress did a great job but clearly she was flustered/overworked/trying to juggle too much at the same time so that in itself set an awkward tone from the start. Sometimes we'd have to wait for something we asked for but we were understanding of her situation. We were all starving so we order the bottomless floats. The ice cream quality was great, and I like that they give you additional rootbeer so that you can add as much or as little as you like. I wanted something basic so I order the tavern burger. Double meat patty, cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickle, onion, sauce on the side. That also came with bottomless fries which I didn't take advantage of because I got full pretty quick just from the first float. The burger itself was really nothing different than what you'd get out of a BK, and there really isn't much else to say about it. The steak fries were hot, and tasty, especially alongside their bbq sauce. So I'm torn between a 2 and 3 stars but upon comparing to other burger places that are around that are offering good quality ingredients at a similar price I have to go with 2, and while yes I have experienced better, I wouldn't be completely against returning either.

This newish Red Robin Location is about on par with most.  I am unable to distinguish any difference from your average TGI, Chilli's or Ruby Tuesday type of food.   The service was "ok" and the food was "ok" but certainly nothing remarkable.  I am surprised they have built a "destination" restaurant that looks cluttered with food that gives you no reason to come back.  I am anxious to try the Rock N Brews next door.  Hopefully they will be a little more inspired with their culinary choices.

Sat at the Bar with Maria as the Bartender/Server.  She is terrific, efficient and helpful.  The burgers, Smoky Jack and Sriracha, were fab. And -- the steak fries refill yummy!! -- thank you Maria.  We enjoyed our visit very much and will return to sit at the Bar, hopefully Maria will be working.  Not sure what these other reviewers are writing about.  There are days when things just go wrong.

I like that Red Robin is in a good location, near the airport. This area is one of the main areas where a lot of tourist stay and eat as well. I was born and raised in Orlando so I remember how this area used to look back in the day and now it just continues to grow.  I've been to this particular location three times and so far I've liked it, they have a variety of burgers from inexpensive to pricey but the food is good!  I got the Tavern burger for $6.99 with there bottomless fries and OMG, the burger had an exquisite sauce, campfire sauce, reminds me a bit of the Chick Fil A sauce :) The only thing that bothered me is that when I went the second time when it wasn't busy, they didn't offer me more fries, so just make sure to tell them you want more because it's a hit or miss depending on the server.

I first heard of Red Robin when I was living in GA in 2011 with my cousin. When I heard it was near me I had to go and check it out because there burgers are truly YUMMM!! I've been to this location about three times and it's been a different experience every time. We tend to go when it's not busy or packed as I don't want my food rushed and cold or don't feel like waiting for a long time.  The first time when it recently opened of course the manager stopped by to introduce himself and tells us about the rewards program, the second time it wasn't even that busy and the server didn't really check on us or offer us more fries and last night it wasn't busy and it took about 5 minutes to get seated bc the hostess was cleaning tables and didn't see us and the gentleman behind us however, the server did offer us more fries.  It breaks my heart giving this location a three because there food is on point but I am HUGE on service and this particular location does not seem strong on this.  This location I feel has potential if customer service improves, especially with the area growing more and more every year, being close to the Orlando Airport and having different shops around it.
Great new design. Very clean- very friendly waiter. Food was good- it's RR, not a wine bar! You get what you get here. Think the other reviews are too harsh haha

Very friendly staff and food was really good. I was redeeming a free birthday burger and usually you get poor service when doing this because the waitress assumes you won't tip on free food, however the bartender was extremely attentive and didn't treat me any different than any other customer and i really appreciated that. It was my first visit and i will definitely be back. Burger was good and came with lots of toppings. Only reason i gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because they are a bit more expensive than the other burger joints in the area.

Stopped in here on Wednesday evening for a birthday celebration. Ordered the Smoke and Pepper burger, which is a half-pound Black Angus burger topped with cheddar cheese, black pepper bacon, and topped with the house made Smoke and Pepper ketchup. I ordered my burger cooked medium, to which our waitress asked if I wanted it with some "pink" or "no pink". I told her that some pink was fine. The Smoke and Pepper burger is one of the better burgers I have had around town. And with an order of Red Robin's bottomless French fries, you don't have to worry about leaving hungry. The service was great, and the dining room was very clean. Red Robin also serves chicken sandwiches, ice cream/milkshakes, and has a full liquor bar. One person in our party is a fan of their onion rings. We followed up with a ice cream sundae with chocolate syrup for dessert. Caramel sauce, sprinkles, and other fun stuff is available for toppings.  Located on Semoran Boulevard near Orlando International Airport, this Red Robin is in a convenient location, with shopping and a movie theater nearby along with OIA. With a variety of burgers to choose from, I will most likely return to try something different. Along with an order of those onion rings my friend is crazy about.

We simply love Red Robin! We go relatively often, and usually get the same thing: Big Tavern Burger for me, the Red's Tavern Double for her, steak fries (bottomless!) for the side, and a root beer float (also bottomless!). Often under-rated (IMHO), we like Red Robin because it's consistently good food, super fast service, and reasonably priced. We've been going to different locations all across the US for several years, and the experience has been the same everywhere. Typically we sit at the bar. Instant seating and fast service: double win! Today we had Ashley, but we've had several different people over our trips. Is this a fancy burger at an high-end restaurant? No. Is it good, fresh-to-order food at a reasonable price? Yes, and I'll take that over the former any day.

So we have been here a few times for burgers and bottomless floats while in the area (usually for Michael's shopping for supplies). We prefer to sit at the bar, just because it's fast service and we enjoy immediate seating options. Bartenders here are always friendly and fast, which is great. We both like the Tavern Double, which comes with bottomless fries and we both get the bottomless root beer float. Normally we only make it through one float each cause they are HUGE. Food comes out fast and they are happy to put in a reorder of fries whenever you want it (if you want it).  The restaurant itself is divided into small section via walls and deco. There are fun decor pieces throughout, so take a look around, I especially like the large sized toy soldiers and rubik cube! A final fun aspect is that they have pay station at the table that you can also play games on for a $1.99 fee. Paying on the machine is free. It's nice and convenient so you don't have to wait for the server to come with the check and then wait again for them to bring back the receipt. Overall: A Good and fast food
This is not the place to go! Food and drinks were mediocre. Staff lacked the enthusiasm and basically forgot to bring our food .

This is my second time at this location, first time reviewing. I really like the style of this place. It's retro style with an 80s 90s motif. The good selection is great. You can choose from a varied selection of burger styles including chicken and fish. There are also appetizers, soups and salads and desserts. I chose the Gardenburger which is a Boca burger style meatless pattie with any fixings I want.  I like that I can choose any burger style and then choose a protein option.  Bring friends and share different items. The bottomless steak fries are worth it. You can also choose sweet potato fries and some other options. Will definitely return.

This location isnt as crowded and hectic as the Winter Garden location, but they also aren't that worried about service. It seems every time I go there's something different about our experience. One server said a particular side we always get as bottomless isn't and charged us for 2. Then the next said it was bottomless but then our. Urges were wrong. Another time we waited forever to be waited on because they just aren't well staffed. When the food is right, it's great. There's plenty of parking (for now - the area is being built up quickly).

We are regulars to this restaurant and absolutely love it.  We have brought family and friends here on a regular basis.  Our last visit, however, had a slight hitch.  The burgers are rather large & in my case requires being cut in half.  I was told by the server that there were no knives available and that they were all in use... REALLY?   I had to cut my burger with a fork.  'N'uff Said!

Whenever I think of Red Robin I thought fast food burgers, which I now clearly see isn't the case. Not only do I give them much respect for actually having a vegan veggie burger on the menu, but holy bottomless sides! I also appreciate the fact the servers are very nice and will take the time to walk back and forth to the kitchen to see what's vegan and what isn't. Another thing i enjoy and take advantage of and the Red Robin Royalty. They actually have awesome deals very often! I recommend anyone to come here! Oh yea and can't forget the awesome bar! They have a pretty large beer selection! Btw I said veggie burger because they recently changed their boca patty to a vegan veggie burger.

We enjoy Red Robin and their $6.99 burgers...AND ENDLESS FRIES :)  Man Oh Man...you can't beat it.  Service was Good and Food was Hot & Fresh.  Just a fun environment for a family meal out and again...Burgers...Who doesn't enjoy a good burger!  Give it a try if you are near by!

Got the smoked pepper burger and fries. I asked for it medium rare and came out medium. Still ate it. My sis got the garlic fries, save the extra upcharge and stick with the regular fries. The burger was good, came with cheese, pickle, bacon and smoked ketchup. The burger was good.
Actually for a  $15 burger and small fries, I'm very disappointed. Even the burger tastes fantastic it doesn't make up for the dissatisfaction. Not sure why I have to give at least 1 star.

Super disappointed... Had a bad experience with take out at this location. Instead of immediately posting on a site like yelp I called the manager to see if he could make it right. He apologized, acknowledged the problem and promised to send a gift card as a credit for the uneadible food. It's been four weeks and I never received the gift card. Will ha e to think twice about visiting this place again.

We had a nice dinner there. Service was great and food was good. Prices reasonable. They have a fun interactive game pod thing but costs $2 to play any games. It's free at Buffalo Wild Wings and it's same system.

We eat here because they are actually careful about gluten free orders. Today was just awful. Burgers were charred and fries were totally overcooked. Our waitress is very good but the kitchen is lackluster.

I am so disappointed in the food and service.  I wanted to give the restaurant a try so I called and placed an order for pick up.  I was told that it would take 15 minutes and all I needed to do was to park in the front of the restaurant in the parking slots marked for pickup.  I parked in the pickup parking spot and after about 25 minutes an employee came out and said are you waiting for an order.  I told her I was and she said well you should have let us know you were here.  I told her nobody informed me that I needed to call again.  After waiting another 5 minutes she brought out my cold food.  I told her the fries were cold, so I had to wait while she went in to get hot fries.  Well the fries came out just as cold.  I noticed that I was also missing the sauces for the dessert, so had to wait for that to come out.  What was supposed to have only taken 20 minutes turned into 45 minutes plus cold food.  I called the number back and pressed the prompt to speak to a customer service representative, however was told that I was supposed to call them again after I arrived.  I told her how disappointed I was and that I would never return.  Food and service terrible- save your money.
Great Place for Any Burger, I love the Bottomless Fries. There Menu Price is just Right

Today was my granddaughter's 6th Birthday and we had a Birthday Dinner here ar Red Robin.  Knowing she and her 3 yr old brother would be hungry,  we ordered the pretzel nuggets to have something on the table when they arrived and decided which dish they wanted to order.  The verdict on the pretzel bites was a Yuck, from both of them. The adults tried a bite and arrived at the same conclusion.... Two burger orders were ok. The Cod fish and chips were very good. The Salmon was over cooked and dry. The kids chicken sticks and nuggets were ok. Good service, but food preparation, even after sending back for corrections, was less than expected from a national chain. Stick to the Burgers!

Although the food was good - service was not.  I came in alone at about 1:30 in the afternoon for a late lunch.  There were other people in the restaurant - not crowded at all.  I was seated quickly by a manager and then completely ignored.  I had asked about the self ordering tablet at the table but was told it was not activated, but a waitress would be right with me.    Ten minutes later when the manager walked by again I stopped him and finally had my order taken.   So, even though I liked the burger, I won't go back

I ordered the crispy chicken salad on numerous occasions from this location - At least 15 times if not more. The order was not always correct but every time brought the issue to their attention they corrected it.

The most expensive burger in town. The service is below average. The only good thing there are the onion rings but burgers are not. I had a full burger plate with fries and paid $12.00 that's beside drinks. Not recommended
